ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates series-selection. Click a series to select it. It's color changes and it is brought to the top of the Z-order
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates the use of the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#Series%20Selection.html']SeriesSelectionModifier[/url], which hooks into the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#What%20is%20the%20ChartModifier%20API.html']ChartModifier API[/url] to select series on mouse-clicks. This complex, but easy to implement example uses many concepts in the ChartModifier API to bind legends and series together.
The selected series is styled via the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.ChartModifiers.SeriesSelectionModifier~SelectedSeriesStyle.html']SeriesSelectionModifier.SelectedSeriesStyle[/url]. A blanket style applied to any series which is selected. Also you can use the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseRenderableSeries~SelectedSeriesStyle.html']BaseRenderableSeries.SelectedSeriesStyle[/url] to achieve the same effect on an individual series level.
Finally, a LegendModifier exposes the currently selected series, and we can use a SciChartLegend to show the name of which series is selected.
